Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run
Tommy Edman homered for the fourth time in 24 hours
Gavin Lux singled in the go-ahead run with two outs in the seventh inning
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers walked 10 batters, including four by starter Bobby Miller
The Dodgers blew a 7-3 lead to Chicago Cubs
The Cubs outscored the Dodgers 16-7 in winning the first two games
Others: The Dodgers answered with four homers in the bottom of the first inning for a 5-2 lead
Will Smith doubled off Shawn Armstrong in the seventh and scored on Lux’s single to center, putting the Dodgers back in front, 8-7
Alex Vesia (3-4) got the win with one inning of relief
The Cubs loaded the bases on two walks by Daniel Hudson and an error by second baseman Chris Taylor before Pete Crow-Armstrong’s RBI single tied it 7-7
Trying to make his case for a postseason roster spot, Miller gave up six runs, including his 16th homer, and five hits in 4 1/3 innings
The Cubs threatened in the ninth. Michael Kopech loaded the bases on consecutive walks to Dansby Swanson, Seiya Suzuki and former Dodger Cody Bellinger
Kopech was called for a pitch-clock violation, giving an automatic ball to Isaac Paredes, whose sacrifice fly cut Chicago’s deficit to 10-8
Suzuki was thrown out trying to steal third and former Dodger Michael Busch struck out swinging to end the game as Kopech eked out his 13th save
